comment.author: 50245058@N03
comment._content: The 19th Alabama Infantry Regiment first fought in the Battle of Shiloh, April 6 - 7, 1862.  It lost one-third of its men during this bloody, two-day battle.  The 19th Alabama had 219 men killed or wounded during the fighting at Shiloh.  Private Paris' Company "I" was predominantly from Cherokee County, Alabama.  This year marks the 150th anniversary of the Battle of Shiloh.

comment.author: 25919039@N00
comment._content:
Parris Pace Casey
Birth 13 NOV 1839 in Spring Garden, Cherokee, Alabama, USA
Death 29 SEP 1863 in Spring Garden, Cherokee, Alabama, USA

Parents: 
Wiley Casey - 1802 – 1891
Matilda White - 1814 – 1907

comment.author: 60188340@N04
comment._content: I always wonder, when I see photos of young men in uniform photographed during war, whether they survived or not. It seems, from the account above, that he died during the war, but, perhaps not because of the war???? Or maybe he died of wounds, but was at home????

comment.author: 12398025@N06
comment._content: A priceless image from a sad and painful place in American history.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: The 19th Alabama also fought at Chickamauga, Sept. 19-20 1863.  That date of death is too close to be coincidental.
